name: MCSB Ontology Glossary
description: Comprehensive glossary for the Microsoft Cloud Security Benchmark Ontology, providing 16-field definitions for all entities, properties, relationships, and enumerations.

terms.name: ControlDomain
terms.description: A high-level security control category within the Microsoft Cloud Security Benchmark that groups related security controls addressing a specific area of cloud security governance. Each domain represents a fundamental aspect of enterprise security posture.
terms.usageExample: The Network Security (NS) domain contains 10 controls covering network segmentation, firewall deployment, and DDoS protection.
terms.usageContext: Use when categorizing security controls by functional area or when generating domain-level compliance reports.
terms.businessMeaning: Provides organizational structure for security controls, enabling executives to understand security coverage by functional area and identify gaps at the domain level.
terms.technicalMeaning: A container entity that aggregates SecurityControl entities sharing common security objectives, enabling hierarchical querying and domain-based filtering.
terms.constraints: domainCode must be unique 2-letter code (NS, IM, PA, etc.). Each domain must have at least one SecurityControl.
terms.aiAgentUsage: AI agents use ControlDomain to filter and group controls, generate domain-level reports, and provide domain-specific guidance. Query pattern: 'List all controls in {domainCode}'

terms.name: SecurityControl
terms.description: A specific security control within the MCSB framework that defines a recommended security practice, implementation guidance for cloud platforms, compliance mappings to industry standards, and responsibility assignments.
terms.usageExample: NS-1 (Establish network segmentation boundaries) is a SecurityControl that belongs to the Network Security domain.
terms.usageContext: Use when defining specific security requirements, tracking compliance status, or generating implementation guidance.
terms.businessMeaning: Represents an actionable security requirement that organizations must implement to protect their cloud workloads. Forms the basis for compliance assessments and audit evidence.
terms.technicalMeaning: Core entity linking security requirements to implementation guidance, compliance frameworks, and assessment status. Central node in the ontology graph.
terms.constraints: controlId must follow DOMAIN-NUMBER format (e.g., NS-1, IM-3). Must belong to exactly one ControlDomain.
terms.relationships: belongsToDomain (1..1) → ControlDomain; hasAzureGuidance (0..1) → ImplementationGuidance; hasAWSGuidance (0..1) → ImplementationGuidance; hasComplianceMapping (0..*) → ComplianceMapping
terms.aiAgentUsage: Central entity for AI agent queries. Agents retrieve controls by domain, compliance mapping, or assessment status. Pattern: 'What is the guidance for {controlId}?'

terms.name: ImplementationGuidance
terms.description: Cloud platform-specific implementation guidance for a security control, providing detailed instructions, recommended services, configuration steps, and reference links for implementing the control in Azure or AWS environments.
terms.usageExample: The Azure guidance for NS-1 recommends using Virtual Networks (VNets), Network Security Groups (NSGs), and Application Security Groups (ASGs) for network segmentation.
terms.usageContext: Use when implementing a specific control in a cloud environment or comparing implementation approaches across platforms.
terms.businessMeaning: Provides actionable steps for security teams to implement controls, reducing ambiguity and enabling consistent security posture across environments.
terms.technicalMeaning: Contains platform-specific instructions linking to cloud services, documentation URLs, and configuration best practices. Enables automated implementation guidance retrieval.
terms.constraints: Must be associated with exactly one CloudPlatform (Azure, AWS, or Multi-Cloud). Must reference at least one documentation URL.
terms.relationships: forControl (1..1) → SecurityControl; usesCloudService (0..*) → CloudService; appliesTo (1..1) → CloudPlatform
terms.aiAgentUsage: Agents retrieve guidance by control and platform. Pattern: 'Show Azure implementation for {controlId}' or 'Compare Azure and AWS guidance for {controlId}'

terms.name: ComplianceMapping
terms.description: A mapping between an MCSB security control and corresponding controls in industry compliance frameworks such as NIST SP800-53, CIS Controls, or PCI-DSS, enabling cross-framework compliance assessments.
terms.usageExample: NS-1 maps to NIST AC-4 (Information Flow Enforcement), SC-2 (Application Partitioning), and SC-7 (Boundary Protection).
terms.usageContext: Use when demonstrating compliance with multiple frameworks or performing gap analysis against specific regulatory requirements.
terms.businessMeaning: Enables organizations to demonstrate compliance with multiple frameworks through a single MCSB implementation, reducing audit burden and compliance costs.
terms.technicalMeaning: Provides bidirectional linkage between MCSB controls and external framework controls. Supports mapping types (full, partial, related) for accuracy.
terms.constraints: Must reference exactly one ComplianceFramework. mappedControlIds must be valid control identifiers for the referenced framework.
terms.aiAgentUsage: Agents use mappings for compliance queries. Pattern: 'Map {controlId} to NIST' or 'Which MCSB controls satisfy PCI-DSS {requirement}?'

terms.name: ResponsibilityAssignment
terms.description: Defines who is responsible for implementing and maintaining a security control under the cloud shared responsibility model. Responsibilities can be Client, Provider, Joint, or Solution Provider.
terms.usageExample: NS-1 (Network Segmentation) has 'Client' responsibility, meaning the customer is solely responsible for implementing network segmentation in their Azure environment.
terms.usageContext: Use when determining accountability for control implementation, generating RACI matrices, or clarifying shared responsibility boundaries.
terms.businessMeaning: Clarifies the division of security responsibilities between cloud provider and customer, essential for governance and audit purposes.
terms.technicalMeaning: Enables responsibility-based filtering and RACI matrix generation. Links to specific actions required by each party.
terms.constraints: responsibilityType must be one of: Client, Provider, Joint, SolutionProvider, ClientSolProvider.
terms.aiAgentUsage: Agents filter controls by responsibility and generate RACI matrices. Pattern: 'List all client-responsible controls' or 'Generate RACI for {domain}'

terms.name: ComplianceFramework
terms.description: An industry-recognized security or compliance framework that defines security controls and requirements, such as NIST SP800-53, CIS Controls, or PCI-DSS.
terms.usageExample: NIST SP800-53 r4 is a ComplianceFramework maintained by NIST that provides security and privacy controls for federal information systems.
terms.usageContext: Use when referencing external compliance requirements or when mapping MCSB controls to regulatory mandates.
terms.businessMeaning: Represents authoritative sources of security requirements that organizations must comply with based on their industry, geography, or contractual obligations.
terms.technicalMeaning: Reference entity for compliance mappings. Contains framework metadata including version, governing body, and control namespace.
terms.constraints: frameworkCode must be one of: NIST, CIS_v7, CIS_v8, PCI_DSS. Version must be specified.
terms.aiAgentUsage: Agents use frameworks to scope compliance queries. Pattern: 'Show all MCSB controls mapped to NIST' or 'Compare CIS v7 and v8 coverage'

terms.name: CloudPlatform
terms.description: A cloud computing platform that hosts workloads and services, such as Microsoft Azure, Amazon Web Services (AWS), or Google Cloud Platform (GCP).
terms.usageExample: Azure is a CloudPlatform provided by Microsoft with specific security services like Azure Firewall and Microsoft Defender for Cloud.
terms.usageContext: Use when filtering implementation guidance by cloud environment or when comparing security approaches across platforms.
terms.businessMeaning: Represents the cloud infrastructure where workloads run, determining which implementation guidance applies.
terms.technicalMeaning: Filter entity for platform-specific guidance retrieval. Links to CloudService entities available on the platform.
terms.constraints: platformCode must be one of: Azure, AWS, GCP, Multi-Cloud.
terms.aiAgentUsage: Agents use platform to filter guidance and services. Pattern: 'Show Azure-specific guidance for {controlId}'

terms.name: CloudService
terms.description: A specific service offered by a cloud platform that is referenced in implementation guidance, such as Azure Firewall, AWS GuardDuty, or Microsoft Defender for Cloud.
terms.usageExample: Microsoft Defender for Cloud is a CloudService that supports implementing multiple controls including ES-1 (EDR), LT-1 (Threat Detection), and PV-5 (Vulnerability Assessment).
terms.usageContext: Use when identifying which cloud services support specific security controls or when planning service deployment.
terms.businessMeaning: Represents tools and services organizations can leverage to implement security controls, informing architecture and procurement decisions.
terms.technicalMeaning: Links controls to concrete implementation options. Enables service-to-control mapping and cost estimation.
terms.constraints: Must belong to exactly one CloudPlatform. serviceCategory must be specified.
terms.aiAgentUsage: Agents recommend services for control implementation. Pattern: 'Which Azure services support {controlId}?' or 'What controls does {serviceName} help implement?'

terms.name: SecurityStakeholder
terms.description: An organizational role responsible for security decisions, implementation, or oversight within the customer organization, such as Security Architecture or Security Operations.
terms.usageExample: The Security Architecture stakeholder is responsible for NS-1 (Network Segmentation) and NS-2 (Secure Cloud Services with Network Controls).
terms.usageContext: Use when assigning accountability for controls or when generating stakeholder-specific compliance reports.
terms.businessMeaning: Identifies who within the organization is accountable for specific security controls, enabling clear governance and escalation paths.
terms.technicalMeaning: Links controls to organizational roles from Microsoft Cloud Adoption Framework. Enables stakeholder-based filtering and reporting.
terms.constraints: stakeholderFunction must align with Microsoft Cloud Adoption Framework security functions.
terms.aiAgentUsage: Agents generate stakeholder reports. Pattern: 'List all controls for Security Operations stakeholder' or 'Who is responsible for {controlId}?'

terms.name: ControlAssessment
terms.description: An evaluation of an organization's implementation status for a specific security control, including assessment findings, gap identification, and remediation recommendations.
terms.usageExample: The assessment for NS-1 shows 'PartiallyCompliant' status with gaps in network segmentation for development environments.
terms.usageContext: Use when tracking compliance status, identifying remediation priorities, or generating compliance dashboards.
terms.businessMeaning: Provides evidence of compliance status for audits and identifies gaps requiring remediation to achieve full compliance.
terms.technicalMeaning: Time-stamped evaluation entity linking controls to their implementation status. Enables trend analysis and prioritized remediation planning.
terms.constraints: assessmentStatus must be one of: Compliant, PartiallyCompliant, NonCompliant, NotApplicable, NotAssessed. If NonCompliant, implementationGaps must be specified.
terms.aiAgentUsage: Agents query assessment status and generate reports. Pattern: 'List non-compliant controls' or 'Show remediation priorities for {domain}'

terms.name: domainCode
terms.description: Two-letter identifier for a control domain within MCSB, used as a prefix for control IDs and for filtering controls by domain.
terms.usageExample: NS is the domainCode for Network Security, IM for Identity Management, PA for Privileged Access.
terms.usageContext: Use when referencing domains in queries or when parsing control IDs to identify parent domain.
terms.businessMeaning: Provides concise reference to control domains in documentation and discussions.
terms.technicalMeaning: Primary key component for ControlDomain entity. Used as prefix in SecurityControl.controlId.
terms.constraints: Must be exactly 2 uppercase letters. Must be unique across all domains. Valid values: NS, IM, PA, DP, AM, LT, IR, PV, ES, BR, DS, GS.
terms.relationships: Identifies parent domain for controls with matching prefix
terms.aiAgentUsage: Agents use domainCode to filter and group controls. Pattern: 'List all {domainCode} controls'

terms.name: controlId
terms.description: Unique identifier for a security control in the format DOMAIN-NUMBER (e.g., NS-1, IM-3), combining domain code with sequential number.
terms.usageExample: NS-1 identifies the first control in the Network Security domain (Establish network segmentation boundaries).
terms.usageContext: Use when referencing specific controls in documentation, assessments, or queries.
terms.businessMeaning: Provides unambiguous reference to specific security requirements across documentation and systems.
terms.technicalMeaning: Primary key for SecurityControl entity. Pattern: ^[A-Z]{2}-\d{1,2}$
terms.constraints: Must follow pattern DOMAIN-NUMBER where DOMAIN is valid domainCode and NUMBER is 1-99.
terms.aiAgentUsage: Primary lookup key for control queries. Pattern: 'Show details for {controlId}'

terms.name: securityPrinciple
terms.description: Detailed explanation of the security principle underlying a control, providing the rationale and context for why the control is important.
terms.usageExample: The security principle for NS-1 explains how network segmentation limits lateral movement and protects high-risk workloads.
terms.usageContext: Use when explaining why a control matters or when training security teams on control objectives.
terms.businessMeaning: Provides business justification for security investments and helps stakeholders understand risk reduction benefits.
terms.technicalMeaning: Extended description field containing security rationale. Minimum 100 characters required.
terms.constraints: Minimum 100 characters. Must explain security benefit and risk mitigation.
terms.aiAgentUsage: Agents include security principle when explaining controls. Pattern: 'Why is {controlId} important?'

terms.name: ResponsibilityType
terms.description: Enumeration defining the types of responsibility assignments in the cloud shared responsibility model.
terms.usageExample: ResponsibilityType.Joint indicates that both customer and cloud provider share responsibility for implementing the control.
terms.usageContext: Use when classifying control responsibilities or filtering controls by ownership.
terms.businessMeaning: Defines who bears accountability for control implementation - critical for contractual and audit purposes.
terms.technicalMeaning: Enumeration values: Client, Provider, Joint, SolutionProvider, ClientSolProvider.
terms.constraints: Must use one of the defined enumeration values.
terms.aiAgentUsage: Agents filter by responsibility type. Pattern: 'List all Joint responsibility controls'

terms.name: AssessmentStatus
terms.description: Enumeration defining the possible states of control implementation assessment.
terms.usageExample: AssessmentStatus.PartiallyCompliant indicates the control is implemented but with gaps requiring remediation.
terms.usageContext: Use when recording or reporting control implementation status.
terms.businessMeaning: Provides standardized status values for compliance reporting and dashboard visualization.
terms.technicalMeaning: Enumeration values: Compliant, PartiallyCompliant, NonCompliant, NotApplicable, NotAssessed.
terms.constraints: Must use one of the defined enumeration values. NonCompliant requires implementationGaps.
terms.aiAgentUsage: Agents filter and report by status. Pattern: 'Show all NonCompliant controls'

terms.name: PriorityLevel
terms.description: Enumeration defining the priority levels for remediation actions based on risk and urgency.
terms.usageExample: PriorityLevel.Critical indicates immediate attention required due to significant security risk.
terms.usageContext: Use when prioritizing remediation efforts or generating prioritized action plans.
terms.businessMeaning: Enables risk-based prioritization of remediation investments and resource allocation.
terms.technicalMeaning: Enumeration values: Critical (immediate), High (30 days), Medium (90 days), Low (180 days).
terms.constraints: Must use one of the defined enumeration values with associated SLA.
terms.aiAgentUsage: Agents sort remediation by priority. Pattern: 'List Critical priority remediations'

terms.name: belongsToDomain
terms.description: Relationship linking a SecurityControl to its parent ControlDomain, establishing the hierarchical structure of the MCSB framework.
terms.usageExample: NS-1.belongsToDomain = Network Security (NS) domain.
terms.usageContext: Use when navigating the control hierarchy or filtering controls by domain.
terms.businessMeaning: Establishes organizational structure for controls enabling domain-level reporting.
terms.technicalMeaning: Many-to-one relationship with cardinality 1..1 (every control belongs to exactly one domain).
terms.constraints: Every SecurityControl must have exactly one belongsToDomain relationship. Control ID prefix must match domain code.
terms.relationships: Source: SecurityControl, Target: ControlDomain, Inverse: hasControl
terms.aiAgentUsage: Agents traverse relationship to find parent domain. Pattern: 'Which domain does {controlId} belong to?'

terms.name: hasComplianceMapping
terms.description: Relationship linking a SecurityControl to its mappings to external compliance frameworks like NIST, CIS, and PCI-DSS.
terms.usageExample: NS-1.hasComplianceMapping includes mappings to NIST AC-4, SC-2, SC-7 and CIS Controls 3.12, 13.4, 4.4.
terms.usageContext: Use when demonstrating compliance coverage or identifying framework-specific requirements.
terms.businessMeaning: Enables multi-framework compliance demonstration through unified MCSB implementation.
terms.technicalMeaning: One-to-many relationship with cardinality 0..* (controls can have multiple mappings).
terms.constraints: Mapping must reference valid ComplianceFramework and provide framework-specific control IDs.
terms.relationships: Source: SecurityControl, Target: ComplianceMapping, Inverse: mapsToControl
terms.aiAgentUsage: Agents retrieve compliance mappings. Pattern: 'Show NIST mappings for {controlId}'

terms.name: Network Security
terms.description: Control domain (NS) covering controls to secure and protect networks, including securing virtual networks, establishing private connections, preventing and mitigating external attacks, and securing DNS.
terms.usageExample: The Network Security domain contains 10 controls including NS-1 (Network Segmentation) through NS-10 (DNS Security).
terms.usageContext: Use when addressing network-level security requirements or when planning network architecture.
terms.businessMeaning: Addresses fundamental network security requirements protecting the connectivity layer of cloud infrastructure.
terms.technicalMeaning: Domain code: NS. Contains controls NS-1 through NS-10. Primary services: VNet, NSG, Azure Firewall, WAF.
terms.constraints: Contains 10 controls. Primarily Client responsibility.
terms.aiAgentUsage: Domain-level queries. Pattern: 'List all Network Security controls'

terms.name: Identity Management
terms.description: Control domain (IM) covering controls to establish secure identity and access controls using identity and access management systems, including SSO, strong authentication, managed identities, conditional access, and account anomaly monitoring.
terms.usageExample: The Identity Management domain contains 9 controls covering centralized identity, application identities, and strong authentication.
terms.usageContext: Use when addressing identity security requirements or planning identity architecture.
terms.businessMeaning: Addresses who can access resources and how they authenticate, foundational to zero-trust architecture.
terms.technicalMeaning: Domain code: IM. Contains controls IM-1 through IM-9. Primary services: Azure AD, AWS IAM.
terms.constraints: Contains 9 controls. Mixed Client/Joint responsibility.
terms.aiAgentUsage: Domain-level queries. Pattern: 'List all Identity Management controls'
